com.kaazing.gateway.jms.client

Class JmsInitialContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.naming.InitialContext
      • com.kaazing.gateway.jms.client.JmsInitialContext

    public class JmsInitialContext
extends InitialContext
    Kaazing JMS Client implementation of InitialContext

    • Field Detail

      • PROVIDER_URL

        public static final String PROVIDER_URL
        Gateway location for connections. To specify this property via system property or in jndi.properties file, use java.naming.provider.url as the property name. 
         For example - 
 java.naming.provider.url=ws://localhost:8001/jms
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CONNECTION_TIMEOUT

        public static final String CONNECTION_TIMEOUT
        Time to wait on initial connection before closing in milliseconds. The default value is 5000 milliseconds. To specify this property via system property or in jndi.properties file, use com.kaazing.gateway.jms.client.connectionTimeout as the property name. 
         For example - 
 com.kaazing.gateway.jms.client.connectionTimeout=10000
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SHUTDOWN_DELAY

        public static final String SHUTDOWN_DELAY
        Time to wait for server to close socket after sending DISCONNECT before closing in milliseconds. The default value is 5000 milliseconds. To specify this property via system property or in jndi.properties file, use com.kaazing.gateway.jms.client.shutdownDelay as the property name. 
          For example - 
  com.kaazing.gateway.jms.client.shutdownDelay=10000
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • RECONNECT_DELAY

        public static final String RECONNECT_DELAY
        Time to wait between reconnect attempts in milliseconds. The default value is 3000 milliseconds. To specify this property via system property or in jndi.properties file, use com.kaazing.gateway.jms.client.reconnectDelay as the property name. 
          For example - 
  com.kaazing.gateway.jms.client.reconnectDelay=5000
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • RECONNECT_ATTEMPTS_MAX

        public static final String RECONNECT_ATTEMPTS_MAX
        Maximum number of reconnect attempts (default to infinite). To specify this property via system property or in jndi.properties file, use com.kaazing.gateway.jms.client.reconnectAttemptsMax as the property name. 
          For example - 
  com.kaazing.gateway.jms.client.reconnectAttemptsMax=5
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • JmsInitialContext

        public JmsInitialContext(Hashtable env)
                  throws NamingException
        Constructs an initial context using the supplied environment.

        The recommended way to construct JmsInitialContext via property java.naming.factory.initial=com.kaazing.gateway.jms.client.JmsInitialContextFactory 

         
 Hashtable env = new Hashtable();
 env.put(Context.INITIAL_CONTEXT_FACTORY, JmsInitialContextFactory.class.getName());
 
 env.put(Context.PROVIDER_URL, "ws://localhost:8001/jms");
 
 env.put(JmsInitialContext.CONNECTION_TIMEOUT, 10000);
 env.put(JmsInitialContext.SHUTDOWN_DELAY, 10000);
 env.put(JmsInitialContext.RECONNECT_DELAY, 5000);
 env.put(JmsInitialContext.RECONNECT_ATTEMPTS_MAX, 5);        
 Context ctx = new InitialContext(env);

 Context ctx = new InitialContext(env);
 
 ConnectionFactory connectionFactory = (ConnectionFactory)ctx.lookup("ConnectionFactory");
        You can also set the property java.naming.factory.initial via system property or in jndi.properties file. In such case you can create JmsInitialContext using no-arg constructor of InitialContext. 
         
 
 // java.naming.factory.initial=com.kaazing.gateway.jms.client.JmsInitialContextFactory 
 // should be specified via system property or in jndi.properties file  
 InitialContext context = new InitialContext()
 
 
         The complete example to specify the provider url and connection properties in jndi.propertile file
  
 java.naming.factory.initial=com.kaazing.gateway.jms.client.JmsInitialContextFactory
 
 java.naming.provider.url=ws://localhost:8001/jms
 
 com.kaazing.gateway.jms.client.connectionTimeout=10000
 com.kaazing.gateway.jms.client.shutdownDelay=10000
 com.kaazing.gateway.jms.client.reconnectDelay=5000
 com.kaazing.gateway.jms.client.reconnectAttemptsMax=5
        Parameters:
        env - the environment for initialization
        Throws:
        NamingException

    • Method Detail

      • lookup

        public Object lookup(String name)
              throws NamingException
        Retrieves the named object.

        The name parameter to Kaazing InitialContext.lookup(String name) can be one of:
        ConnectionFactory: to fetch a JMS ConnectionFactory instance
        DestinationFactory: to fetch the destination factory instance
        /topic/destination: to fetch the topic named "destination"
        /queue/destination: to fetch the queue named "destination"

        Specified by:
        lookup in interface Context
        Overrides:
        lookup in class InitialContext
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the object to look up
        Returns:
        the object bound to name
        Throws:
        NamingException - If a naming exception is encountered.
